授業方法: This course will be held face-to-face. Every content lesson will be based on an academic English reading (usually 8 - 15 pages) and consist of an in-person lecture supported by PowerPoint slides and student notetaking. Three lessons will be designated for Unit Tests, and the final lesson will be designated for course review and completion of the Final Writing Assignment.All course readings and handout materials will be distributed to students via the course LUNA site. Students are expected to access and use electronic course materials on their own. No printed materials will be provided.

トピック.授業計画1: Most weekly sessions will follow a similar pattern. Students will carefully read an academic English text on the topic of that week, then attend the in-person lecture, where they will take notes and participate in discusssions and activities. Three sessions are designated to complete the three Unit Tests. Instead of a course Final Exam, students will complete the Final Writing Assignment in the last session.
トピック.授業外学習2:
Student preparation outside of class meetings includes:
(1) Carefully reading the required weekly texts in preparation for lectures
(2) Completing lecture-related activities following lectures
(3) Studying for Unit Tests
(4) Preparing for the Final Writing Assignment

教科書/Required texts0: All reading materials will be provided by the instructor on LUNA. Students can expect approximately 8-15 pages of academic English reading preparation per week.
参考文献・資料/Reference books0:

Galloway, N. & Rose, H. (2015). Introducing Global Englishes. London: Routledge.
